Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the difference in rules between members of Congress and other Americans under Obamacare.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that members of Congress do not have to abide by the same rules as other Americans under Obamacare.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that members of Congress have special privileges or exemptions under Obamacare, which may not be entirely accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation, stating that members of Congress are required to use the Obamacare marketplaces like everyone else, but previously had different insurance options.
